p: There were patterns of more dengue cases in wards that had market places “ Fig 2” a further study will need to look into this. At the moment it will be treated as a suggestive of improper refuse disposal that may have a role to play in the spread of dengue in such areas. Therefore environmental control and public awareness/education about breeding habitats before the rain begins should be prioritized. None of the Aedes found was Ae. africanus, which maintains sylvatic, yellow fever, or Ae. albopictus that is an introduced southeast Asian species, competent for dengue that shares breeding sites with Ae. aegypti currently invading into several African countries [ 37] but has not yet been found in Tanzania[ 6, 38]
